item.source: How to make yell bank wealth?

item.title: How to make yell bank wealth?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:7, topic:546576”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=665474.msg4448829#msg4448829 date=1410210274]

do you know the bank wealth
[/quote] i want it to automaticly add the players bank wealth to the place i want it

It’d help if you provided a bit more information on your server…
Read the link in my signature for help on making a better topic, that way we can help you more efficiently and accurately.

What you need to do (and this is why I said ^^^) is loop through all the items in the players bank, and get the value of each item (probably based on store value… Unless you have a system with dynamic prices). Then you will have to multiply that value by how many of the item they have. Lastly, you will need to add the value of all the items in that stack (Which you just generated) together, to get the standing value.

Note: I wouldn’t use an Integer if your economy is anything like the average 317 PI’s…

Why would you when a single stack of cash (achieved by quite a few people in real rs) has the value of an integers bound?

Because cash stack + the value of every item does have the potential to overflow…[/quote]
^This
Hint: Some server’s have “2 billion cash bags” or some form of an item similar. Literally just 2 of those would put you above the max value of an int.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make yell bank wealth?

item.title: How to make yell bank wealth?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:5, topic:546576”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665474.msg4448800#msg4448800 date=1410203790]

do you know the bank wealth
[/quote] i want it to automaticly add the players bank wealth to the place i want it

It’d help if you provided a bit more information on your server…
Read the link in my signature for help on making a better topic, that way we can help you more efficiently and accurately.

What you need to do (and this is why I said ^^^) is loop through all the items in the players bank, and get the value of each item (probably based on store value… Unless you have a system with dynamic prices). Then you will have to multiply that value by how many of the item they have. Lastly, you will need to add the value of all the items in that stack (Which you just generated) together, to get the standing value.

Note: I wouldn’t use an Integer if your economy is anything like the average 317 PI’s…

Why would you when a single stack of cash (achieved by quite a few people in real rs) has the value of an integers bound?[/quote]

Because cash stack + the value of every item does have the potential to overflow…

@Sk8tr You should use a long regardless of whether or not your “economy” is bad, everything could potentially overflow and you should plan for it.

Read full topic

It’d help if you provided a bit more information on your server…
Read the link in my signature for help on making a better topic, that way we can help you more efficiently and accurately.

What you need to do (and this is why I said ^^^) is loop through all the items in the players bank, and get the value of each item (probably based on store value… Unless you have a system with dynamic prices). Then you will have to multiply that value by how many of the item they have. Lastly, you will need to add the value of all the items in that stack (Which you just generated) together, to get the standing value.

Note: I wouldn’t use an Integer if your economy is anything like the average 317 PI’s…

Why would you when a single stack of cash (achieved by quite a few people in real rs) has the value of an integers bound?[/quote]

Are you asking why would I use an Integer, or why wouldn’t I use one?
Because it’d be illogical with the average RSPS economy to use an Integer…
